projects.title: Standalone Search
projects.description: Being completely disatisfied with the slow, clunky, and convoluted mess which is SharePoint, I headed an effort to create a stanalone front-end for our search engine.  One of our back-end developers created a REST-ful API, and I worked with a fellow front-end developer to create a lightweight AJAX-powered front-end.  We used Backbone.js for the client-side MVC framework, Handlebars.js as the templating language, and Bootstrap as the front-end framework.

projects.title: Designicity
projects.description: This was my first freelance design project for a friend I grew up with.  I created a blog engine with a gallery view of all the images, blogroll of all entries, and individual blog entry pages.  I used Bootstrap for the front-end framework, Wok to create the blog engine, and the Masonry and BlackandWhite jQuery plugins.

projects.title: Search 3.0
projects.description: Our search engine at Boeing was replaced with FAST Search for SharePoint 2010, and I led the efforts to create our own custom design for the search center.  This was my first responsive design project, and I created a high-fidelity prototype using HTML and CSS3.  That design was then implemented into SharePoint by creating a custom master page and modified XSLT, along with a few design enhancements.  Needless to say, I developed a healthy distaste for SharePoint design.

projects.title: Search 2.0
projects.description: Upon arriving at the Enterprise Search group, I observed a very outdated poorly organized web presence.  I redesigned the site to give the site a more modern look and feel, as well as making the user reference materials more easily discoverable.  I implemented the design in May, 2009 and it was used until its retirement in June, 2012.

projects.title: IT Leadership Development
projects.description: I worked on a 3-person team to redesign the web presence for Boeing's IT Leadership Development organization.  We conducted user research to create user personas, then went through several iterations of design prototyping and user testing to validate our design concepts.  After our design was finalized, I created a high-fidelity prototype using HTML and CSS.
